intro: Matelea crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Matelea crassifolia is typically found in woodlands and canyons, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
